result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristine A Gassen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution directly to Clerk of Courts.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate.
Unless disabled, defendant shall be employed no less than 25 hours a week. If not disabled and not employed, defendant shall seek 3 job applications a week and provide documentation to DOC monthly.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristine A Gassen

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kristine A Gassen appeared by phone.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Kristine A Gassen. Defendant is currently at Platteville PD, had wrong location. Attorney Bartelt believes that matter is resolved. Attorney Bartelt to call Platteville PD to see if she can get here and then let court know. Attorney Bartelt heard on defendant's appearance and does not have a ride to court and asks if she can appear by phone. 1205 back on record. Defendant is okay with proceeding with sentencing via phone. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to charge. State will recommend 1 year probation, to pay restitution, to work full time or to seek work. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to charge. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 1 year probation. Condition of probation is to pay $762.26 in restitution to Farm and Fleet, unless disabled, defendant shall be employed no less than 25 hours a week or seek 3 jobs application per week and document with DOC, court costs are waived, DNA, and treatment, counseling, programming, and assessment that DOC deems appropriate.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

and arraignment: Defendant Kristine A Gassen in court after hearing continued to 11:45 due to difficulties finding ride.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by phone for Kristine A Gassen. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Bond set at $200 signature. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Not guilty plea entered. Status and trial weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
